{{for|other uses|Boss}} {{spoiler}} '''Bosses''' (Japanese: {{lang|ja|ボス}}, ''Bosu'') are [[Enemy (XC3)|enemies]] in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. As with most games, they tend to appear at the end of a specific portion of the game, they are related to the story event (directly or not, like Quest ones). Bosses have unique names, they can be a character or a monster, they have high stats and potentially unique skills. Bosses can be identified by the emblem that appears behind the level on their field icon. If a Boss must be defeated for story progression, they will also have a special icon left of their name in their window frame. == {{XC3|-}} == === Story Bosses === {| class="xc1 sortable" !Name !Level revision.comment: Created page with "{{Infobox item |name = Brace Vambraces |image = |caption = Boosts damage dealt when attack higher-level enemies by 65%. |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Legendary |source = [[Prize X-change Blue]] |sell = [[Gold|G]] }} '''Brace Vambraces''' are DLC [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessories]] in {{XC3}}. It can be purchased from [[Prize X-change Blue]] in the [[Land of Challenge (XC3)|Land of Challenge]] for 6000 [[Noponstone]]s. {{clr}} {{..."

revision.text:
{{for|mechanics from other games|Break}} [[File:XC3 Break Icon.png|thumb|Break Icon]] '''Break''' is a reaction status in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. When inflicted, it staggers the enemy, interrupting any ongoing attacks and allowing the enemy to be [[Topple (XC3)|Toppled]].
The chances of Break being inflicted can be increased by Fury Smash, a class skill of the [[Ogre]] class, and enemy Break resistance can be reduced via [[Break Brooch]]es or [[Accomplished Vambraces]]. The duration of Break can be increased via the [[Chrome Scarf (XC3)|Chrome Scarf]], [[Unicorn Scarf (XC3)|Unicorn Scarf]] or [[Quantum Scarf (XC3)|Quantum Scarf]]. Party members can equip [[Assist Belt]]s, [[Harness Belt]]s or [[Survival Belt]]s to increase their own resistance to Break.
== Break-inflicting Arts == * [[Sword Strike (XC3)|Sword Strike]] ([[Swordfighter]]); Only inflicts Break when attacking from the side. * [[Flashback]] ([[Yumsmith]], Master Art); Only inflicts Break when attacking from the side. * [[Wok-a-Block]] ([[Riku & Manana]]); Only inflicts Break when attacking from the side. * [[Glitter Stream]] ([[Incursor]]); Only inflicts Break when attacking from the side. * [[Etched Deep]] ([[Alexandria]]); Only inflicts Break when attacking from the side. * [[Tri-Slash]] ([[Noponic Champion]]) * [[Starry Beat]] ([[Ino]]) * [[Phantom Slash]] ([[Noah]], [[Ouroboros]]); Only inflicts Break when at [[Interlink]] Level 3. * [[Full Moon Drop]] ([[Mio]], Ouroboros); Only inflicts Break when at Interlink Level 3. * [[Hawk Shot]] ([[Soulhacker]]); Only inflicts Break when attacking from the side. * [[Winning Rush]] ([[Lanz]], Ouroboros); inflicts Break as part of a [[Launch (XC3)|Launch]] combo. * [[Final Lucky Seven]] (Noah); inflicts Break as part of a [[Smash (XC3)|Smash]] combo. == Break-inflicting Skills == * [[Sena#Skills|Utterly Crushing]] ([[Sena]], Ouroboros); chance to inflict Break when attack would be guarded.
== In {{XC3FR|sub}} == === Break-inflicting Arts === * [[Backspin Punch]] ([[Matthew (FR)|Matthew]]) * [[Stream Edge (XC1)|Stream Edge]] ([[Shulk]])
[[Category:XC3 Status]] [[Category:XC3FR Status]]

|-|Common = {{Infobox item |name = Break Brooch |image = XC3 Accessory Medal.png |caption = Lowers attack targets' Break resistance by 20 percentage points. |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Common |source = |sell = 9150 [[Gold|G]] }} |-|Rare = {{Infobox item |name = Break Brooch |image = XC3 Accessory Medal.png |caption = Lowers attack targets' Break resistance by 22 percentage points. |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Rare |source = |sell = 9150 [[Gold|G]] }} |-|Legendary = {{Infobox item |name = Break Brooch |image = XC3 Accessory Medal.png |caption = Lowers attack targets' Break resistance by 25 percentage points. |type = [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] |xc3rarity = Legendary |source = |sell = 9150 [[Gold|G]] }}
'''Break Broochs''' are [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessories]] in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. {{clr}} {{xc3 stub}} {{fr stub}} [[Category:XC3 Accessories]] [[Category:XC3FR Accessories]]

{{Infobox Gem | name = Brimming Spirit | image = Gem-defender.png | effect = [Passive] Boosts aggro generated when using Art by ''(value)%''. | category = Defender | max = 45% }} '''Brimming Spirit''' is a Defender [[Gem]] in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. == Gem Stats == {| class="xc1 gem-stats centered" style="width: 200px" ! !Aggro Increase |- !I |20% |- !II |22% |- !III |25% |- !IV |27% |- !V |30% |- !VI |32% |- !VII |35% |- !VIII |37% |- !IX |40% |- !X |45% |} == List of Recipes == At [[Rest Spot (XC3)|Rest Spots]], [[Riku]] will [[Gem Crafting|craft]] [[Gem]]s using items picked up during adventures or acquired from [[enemy (XC3)|enemies]]. [[File:Gluttonous Eugen.png|thumb|The Gluttonous Eugen]] '''Brogs''' (Japanese: {{lang|ja|グロッグ}}, ''Guroggu''; [[English dub pronunciations|English dub]]: {{IPA|/ˈbrɒɡ/}}) are a family of frog-like monsters in the {{XC|serieslink}}. This species is close to the [[Rhana]]s but there are less Rhana types than Brog types. In all games, Brogs can usually be found in watery areas.
== {{XC|-}} == In {{XC}}, Brogs are found outside [[Colony 9 (XC1)|Colony 9]], in [[Tephra Cave]], on [[Bionis' Leg]], in [[Satorl Marsh]], and in [[Makna Forest]]. They come in green, purple, and white varieties. The most powerful Brog in the game is the [[Young Brog (XC1)|Young Brog]], found in Tephra Cave at level 95.
=== Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Big Brog]] * [[Cute Brog]] * [[Detox Brog (XC1)|Detox Brog]] * [[Heavy Brog (XC1)|Heavy Brog]] * [[Makna Brog]] * [[Noble Brog]] * [[Poison Brog (XC1)|Poison Brog]] * [[Singing Brog]] * [[Young Brog (XC1)|Young Brog]]
=== Quest-Exclusive Enemies === * [[Abnormal Brog]] (during ''[[The Greedy Monster]]'') * [[Lurker Brog]] (during ''[[A Young Captain's Rise]]'')
=== Unique Monsters === * [[Gentle Rodriguez]] * [[Gluttonous Eugen]] * [[White Eduardo]]
== {{XCFC|sub}} == In {{XCFC|sublink}}, Brogs are found exclusively on the [[Bionis' Shoulder]].
=== Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Noble Brog]] * [[Poison Brog (XC1)|Poison Brog]]
=== Unique Monster === * [[Booming Frederick]] {{clr}}
== {{XC2|-}} == In {{XC2}}, Brogs are mainly found in [[Gormott Province]], with a few in [[Temperantia]], the [[Leftherian Archipelago]], and the [[Kingdom of Uraya]]. They come in green, yellow, purple and red varieties. These Brogs look slightly different to the Brogs in {{XC|-}}.
=== Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Bobbile Brog (XC2)|Bobbile Brog]] * [[Cave Brog]] * [[Goliath Brog (XC2)|Goliath Brog]] * [[Pactusk Brog]] * [[Poison Brog (XC2)|Poison Brog]] * [[Small Brog]]
=== Quest-Exclusive Enemy === * [[Vacuum Brog]] (During ''[[Into the Open Sky]]'')
=== Unique Monster === * [[Venal Montgomery]]
=== Boss === * [[Wormeater Brog]] {{clr}}
== {{TTGC|-}} == In {{TTGC}}, Brogs can be found both in [[Gormott (TTGC)|Gormott]] and the [[Kingdom of Torna]]. They come in green and yellow varieties.
=== Normal Minor Enemy === * [[Dormine Brog]]
=== Quest-Exclusive Enemy === * [[Appet Brog]] (during ''[[Safety Measures]]'')
=== Unique Monster === * [[Handwringing Bigelow]] {{clr}}
== {{XC3|-}} == In {{XC3}}, Brogs can be found in many places across [[Aionios]].
=== Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Begest Brog]] * [[Bobbile Brog (XC3)|Bobbile Brog]] * [[Detox Brog (XC3)|Detox Brog]] * [[Goliath Brog (XC3)|Goliath Brog]] * [[Heavy Brog (XC3)|Heavy Brog]] * [[Princess Brog]] * [[Sweetless Brog]] * [[Young Brog (XC3)|Young Brog]]
=== Unique Monsters === * [[Indiscreet Gombaba]] * [[Ruthless Grokken]]
== {{XC3FR|sub}} == === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Bobbile Brog (XC3)|Bobbile Brog]]
=== Unique Monster === * [[Prohibitor Giuseppe]]
== Etymology == ''Brog'' and ''Crog'' are both simple analogues of ''frog'', while ''rhana'' comes from the latin genus name ''[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rana_(genus) rana]'' (pond frogs).
== Gallery == === {{XC|-}} === <gallery> Cute Brog.jpg White Eduardo.jpg Poison Brog.jpg </gallery>
=== {{XC2|-}} === <gallery> Wormeater Brog.jpg|Wormeater Brog PoisonBrog.jpg|Poison Brog Bobbile Brog.png|Bobbile Brog </gallery>
=== {{TTGC|-}} === <gallery> HandwringingBigelow.jpg|Handwringing Bigelow AppetBrog.jpg|Appet Brog DormineBrog.jpg|Dormine Brog </gallery>
=== {{XC3|-}} === <gallery> XC3 Indiscreet Gombaba.jpg|Indiscreet Gombaba XC3 Young Brog.jpg|Young Brog </gallery>
